title: Spatial Arrangement and Cognitive Load Management in Augmented Reality Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic augmented reality (AR) concepts and foundational pedagogical knowledge
context.additional_context: Pre-service/in-service teachers design augmented reality-based instructional materials for real classrooms, learn flexibly via personal devices, and demonstrate application skills through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Learners can explain the impact of horizontal/vertical information placement on cognitive load in AR environments.
Learners can apply principles for optimal spatial layout design during procedural content interactions.
Learners can improve AR learning environment designs by analyzing pupil dilation and fixation duration data.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
